data.title: Enjoyed our stay (having changed our initial allocated room)
data.text: The room we were initially allocated overlooked the very busy road outside (I believe an Interstate).  The traffic noise was too loud for me, so as we were staying two nights I asked Reception if we could be moved and they accommodated us in a room right opposite (which overlooked the pool).  No road noise on this side and we heard no noise from the room next to us either, so had two good nights sleep.  Complimentary breakfast was also appreciated.  It had been suggested that the elevators were slow, but we had no problem and we were on the 10th floor.  We used the shuttle bus service both nights to Beale Street and had no problem getting back to the hotel each night.  We didn't even have to 'phone the hotel to return as the minibuses keeping driving in the loop all night and drop off/pick up at Hard Rock Cafe and we were lucky both times to coincide with their arrival. You do need to book your time to leave hotel with Reception and it's best to do this as soon as you have an idea of the time you might want to leave, otherwise you may have to go earlier/later if it is already fully booked.

data.title: Much better than expected
data.text:
This is my first stay here and if you don't want to read further, I will stay here again .
The check in process was a bit slow but Angela the associate at the desk made is as smooth as she possibly could and was very accommodating to our group. 
The rooms are tastefully done, the linens are fresh and bright and most important, comfortable. The restaurant serves a good simple breakfast buffet in the morning. The fitness room is adequate for a quick hotel workout. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Much better than I expected when I pulled up. There is self park in the back at $17 a day and a little shop in the lobby for snacks and drinks. Enjoy

data.title: Great experience
data.text: We had an amazing stay at the Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown. Angela and the rest of the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was 10 out of 10. We had a beautiful city skyline room with more than enough amenities. Hotel shuttle brought us everywhere we needed to be and picked us up. Staff was pleasant and welcoming, everything was clean and taken care of. Full bar and restaurant if you need it. Thanks Crowne Plaza for a great stay in Memphis.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We appreciate the outstanding review and are delighted to know how much you enjoyed your stay. Thanks so much for acknowledging the excellent service you received from our staff, especially from Angela. We are also glad you liked our well-appointed property and the facilities we have to offer. Your feedback is important and lets us know how we are performing. Thanks again from all of us at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown. We hope to see you and your friends again soon!

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent  Hospitality
data.text: It’s a great place to stay. The staff was friendly caring, excellent and pleasantness. I experienced WOW service. I love the fact that the hotel offered free shuttle to Beale Street and the downtown area. I have list of each staff members that need to be recognized: Alton/Darien (Front Desk/Guest Service) Mr. Taylor/Kenneth/Jewell (shuttle drivers) Kenneth/Sharon/Tameira (Bar Area) Cedric (Banquet Area) Roy (Cook**He made the best omelet) Harry (Night Manager). I highly recommend the hotel to others. The breakfast buffet was amazing. We also got a chance to try the new re-vamped menu and the wings were amazing.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

I will be sure to share your recognition with each of the staff member you mentioned. It was our pleasure to have you as our guest, and we can't wait to host you again on a future visit to Memphis!

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Memphis
data.text: For price, good location. Not far from action downtown, 1 mile. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Breakfast was a bit high on price but it's a buffet. They have a shuttle that takes you downtown as well as other places. Room was good size and beds were comfy.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

It was our pleasure having you as our guest, and we hope you and your family will choose us again when you are back in our wonderful city.

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager

data.title: Great service!
data.text: The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. We were lucky enough to arrive on the day of the renovation grand opening! We had a great time after a long day at the airport. We will definitely coming back when visiting Memphis.

data.title: Again don't book your room or event
data.text: This hotel had a re grand opening with in the year I have been here. The menu has no local cuisine it's Memphis people, where a the BBQ and catfish ? So they had a open or soft opening the staff acted like they didn't want to be there and didn't care. The bar upstairs had to pull teeth for a drink everything was free by the way. Went downstairs and two stations one pasta with catfish or grill chicken? The other one salmon and beef tenderloin ( the prep chef sliced the meat and salmon and left the station unintended) while everyone serve themselves the pasta guy didn't want to be there and kept telling guest he was closing he barely heated the food which was cold excuse me food poising not heated at the right temperature. Then the staff wanted to pick up your plates while you are eating due to they wanted to go home. I talked to the manger and mention my concerns the bartender was ready to go until he mention me. DAMAGE DONE??? I left

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel. Please accept our apologies for the frustration and inconvenience you experienced due to our unresponsiveness. Your comments have been shared with the team in order to avoid such mistakes going forward. Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity of welcoming you back soon.

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazingly Friendly Staff and Free Shuttle to Beale St
data.text:
Stayed here one night while driving a U-haul across multiple states.  The staff are very welcoming and friendly.  Parking is 17$  in an outdoor gate access lot, so parking a uhaul was easy. 
Best part was the free shuttle to Beale street (they go anywhere downtown) and you just call for a pick up when you were ready to go back to hotel. 
The bed was very comfortable with great air conditioner.  (we like the room 65 at night) 
Location was just off the freeway and getting on and off freeway was very easy, no city street traffic to deal with.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

We are delighted to read how much you enjoyed every aspect of our hotel, especially the convenience of our shuttle service and our friendly staff. We believe our associates are our best asset, and they truly enjoy creating a welcoming and friendly environment for all of our guests. Thanks again for allowing us to be of service. We hope to have the pleasure of doing so again in near future.

data.title: Closish to downtown Memphis
data.text: Lovely big room comfortable bed, table and chairs. Overlooking noisy interstate to the north. Valet parking reasonably priced but there is street parking not far away. Free downtown shuttle but very interesting to walk in 20mins .

data.title: Holiday
data.text: Great hotel with friendly and efficient staff with nothing being too much trouble. Breakfast was varied and dinner menu, although restricted, was delicious.Recommended for sightseeing in and around Memphis as walking distance to downtown Memphis.

data.title: NIce Hotel  - Staff is a little distant
data.text: If you are looking for a downtown Memphis location, this hotel sits in a fairly ideal location to local downtown restaurants and attractions.  The hotel appears to be recently updated, and it looks and feels modern and comfortable.  My room was located on a higher floor with a great view of downtown.  Bed was comfortable, good climate control in the room - it was July - so keeping it cool was important.  A mini fridge was in the room so we could keep cold beverages in the room.  The bathroom was nicely appointed with the usual Crowne Plaza amenities - a very comfortable room.  I enjoyed the Breakfast Buffet one time while there - food was good and reasonably priced for a standard breakfast buffet.  The staff in the hotel really appeared to be just "ticking the boxes until quitting time" never felt welcomed by the staff or that anyone genuinely appreciated you as a customer.  I'm no Diva nor do I expect anyone to "kiss my feet" but a genuine Thank you and smile is always nice - I felt as If my presence was more of an imposition....no complaints about the actual facility if the customer facing staff could stretch just a tad - smile, please and thank you ...I would most definitely recommend and return.  So that is the reason for my average rating.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We appreciate your observations and thank you for recommending us to future guests. We are glad that you loved your room with the beautiful view and enjoyed all its amenities. Also, we are delighted that our location was convenient for you and that you were pleased with the facilities that we served you. However, we apologize for the inconvenience you encountered with our staff. I will look into the matter to know what went wrong and will make sure this isn’t repeated in the future. Thanks again, and we hope our hotel is your first choice every time you visit the Birthplace of the Blues!

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: LOCATED IN AN IDEAL SPOT
data.text: Stayed there two nights and found it very comfortable,the breakfast was good the rooms clean and tidy and the staff helpful. The free shuttle into town is good and Drivers very helpful.there is a well stocked bar and the bar area is comfortable,Would stay there again.

data.title: Great hotel and lovely people at the reception
data.text:
We liked our stay at the Crown Plaza Hotel. It's a clean and modern hotel. Just 15 minutes walking from the center of Memphis. The people in the hotel are very helpfull and friendly. Especially the people from the reception were great ( thank you Angela and collegue)
Greetings from the Dutch brothers

data.title: Fantastic Staff
data.text:
Arrived 2.10 English time and just wanted to sleep, I found the room to be large if a little dated, but the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The breakfast was $15 dollars for cooked and $12 for continental which was really very good especially the scrambled egg.
The staff were always polite. I found the open plan room with the bar, dining and lounge not to my liking, 3 big tv screens all in a confined area. The lounge area with very little comfortable seating. The bar staff Tiffany and Gyrrac were great, Mr. Taylor one of the drivers of the free shuttle service was amazing. He took us around to various stops and was always giving a guided tour with so much information. I loved to sit in the garden area which was so well kept. This hotel is not what I would call a four star but the staff are really amazing , so polite and courteous they deserve a bonus.
If only all hotels were the same, I recommend this hotel and would return should  I return to this area, well done the staff of the Crown Plaza

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

I will definitely let Tiffany, Gyrrac, and Taylor know how much they added to your enjoyment. Thanks again, we look forward to your return. 

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: BEWARE OF PARKING CHARGES!
data.text:
Stayed here as we were passing through TN. Room was clean, bed extremely comfortable and great location to anything downtown. (Complimentary shuttle) however they charged me for parking upon check in ($17 btw) and as I was leaving the next morning I could not get out of the parking lot w/o using my cc and paying to leave. I called the front desk as we were leaving and her response was "oh all you had to do was press the assistant button and we would have let you out". I was never informed of this info the night before at the desk. What a terrible protocol they have for their parking lot. Personally I think it's a scam. 
Always check your receipt! (the paper on the floor that you usually step on as you're  leaving the next morning 😜

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown. We are delighted to read how much you enjoyed your room and got a great night’s sleep. Having said that, we apologize our front desk team did not inform you about our parking charges and for the inconvenience this caused you. Our team takes pride in delivering outstanding service to all guests, and we are sorry for disappointing you. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and hope you will choose us the next time so we can show you the wonderful hospitality we normally provide.  

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager

data.title: Great staff working the lobby and the halls!
data.text:
We were there for the Mississippi River Network's annual meeting, and I thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality. 

Particularly, Stanley Henderson, Yaya Williams, Kimberly Morgan, and Gina Kelly made the stay even more comfortable.  I appreciated their hard work and they took time to hear about the nonprofit campaign I work with.  In fact, they are now River Citizens, protectors of the Mississippi River!  Cheers!

from arriving to exiting, I found the whole experience satisfying, the staff, the rooms, the free shuttle into the city and back, and most importantly well appointed, comfortable, well serviced rooms.
well done all.

data.title: Southern Hospitality at its Finest!
data.text: This hotel was selected based on its great location, however this review is being written because of the great staff! We visited Memphis for a weekend in August (arrived Friday night and checked out on Sunday morning) and from the time of our arrival until we left we were overwhelmed by the staff at this location. Whether it was having the front desk attendant sing her own version of happy birthday to my daughter or the shuttle driver who gave us a great recommendation for some Memphis BBQ the entire weekend was more than was expected from a customer service perspective. The rooms were clean and breakfast buffet with an omelet station was delicious. I will definitely stay at this property again and again whenever I am in Memphis.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
First of all, belated Happy Birthday to your daughter! Thank you for choosing Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown and taking the time to review your stay. It is a pleasure to read about the excellent service you received from our staff. This is what we strive to do every day, so we thank you for acknowledging their efforts. We are also glad to know that you liked your clean room and loved the breakfast buffet. Thanks once more, and we look forward to your next visit whenever your travels bring you back to Memphis!

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very disappointed
data.text: From start to finish, my experience was poor. While the room was nice, the customer service at the front desk was also very poor. I had arrived around 5:30pm after travelling all day and even though I reserved my room almost a month in advance, I was told on arrival that there were no rooms available. The solution to this was to have a drink at the bar on the hotel. After TWO hours, a room was found. Later during my stay,  the housekeeping staff left my door open after they were done cleaning. Again, the solution was to provide a free drink. The service at the bar was abysmal. Even though there were only a few people in the lounge, it took 15 minutes for a drink and even longer for food. I also had work colleagues who experienced no rooms available upon check in, people trying to get into their room at 1am stating loudly from outside the door that the hotel had given away their room. Overall, my experience was very poor. I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

owner_response.author: ManagerX1, General Manager at Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Sarah, thank you for evaluating your stay with us. We are disappointed to learn that your room was not ready upon your arrival, and we apologize for your unusually long delay in checking in.  All rooms should be ready by our check-in time; however, in times of high occupancy, slight delays may occur. We are sorry our service was definitely not up to par while you were our guest, and we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with a much warmer welcome and an outstanding stay the next time you are in this area.

Sincerely,
Mark Baker
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text:
Lovely Hotel very clean and modern. We had a huge picture window over looking Memphis.
The hotel is a little out of town but they offer a free shuttle bus that will take you anywhere in the downtown area and pick you up again. All the drivers are really friendly you just phone when you want to be picked up.
Great Hotel would recommend happily
